column4: xfce atint the best desktop to use if you need to ask those questions though
wasnt saying best as in the best was saying its not user friendly like gnome
I would say xfce is the best to go for the way the other DE are going though, have never liked kde
I like LXDE personally, no nonsense
there are plenty of DEs to go at, more than XFCE, KDE and Gnome
yeah Ive usually used tty1 for most things though apart from if a gui is needed :)
it's EOL at the same time as Oneiric...
so all the packages on an LTs are the same as the latest?
will be slightly different, Oneiric will have later stuff
As I come from Red Hat based I see LTS as CentOs and the latest as Fedora but only ever used LTS
its dead upstream, there may be forks like 'mate'
swap is also needed for hibernate / suspend reasons
I forgot all about them because never used them.
its still exists and is desirable for others, so swap can be needed
